definitions.text: a keeping of the Sabbath, a Sabbath rest.

a Sadducee, a member of the aristocratic party among the Jews, from
                  whom the high-priests were almost invariably chosen.
I fawn upon, flatter, beguile; pass: I am perturbed.
Sala, the name of two of the ancestors of Jesus.
Salamis, a city at the eastern end of Cyprus.
I shake, excite, disturb in mind, stir up, drive away.
Salmon, son of Nahshon and father of Boaz.
Salmone, a promontory on the east of Crete.
the tossing of the sea in a tempest
the tossing of the sea in a tempest; agitation, rolling.
a trumpet, the sound of a trumpet.

Salome, wife of Zebedee and mother of James and John, the
                  apostles.

Samaria, a small district of Palestine, bounded by Galilee on the
                  north, and by Judaea on the south, and taking its name from the city of Samaria,
                  the ancient capital of the kingdom of (northern) Israel.
Samothrace, an island south of the province of Thrace.

Samos, an island in the Aegean sea off the coast of Asia Minor, near
                  Ephesus and Miletus.
Samson, one of the Judges of Israel.

Saul, (a) the first king of Israel, (b) the Hebrew name of the Apostle
                  to the Gentiles.
Sapphira, wife of Ananias, an early Christian.
a basket, generally of twisted cords.
Sardis, an ancient city of Lydia in the province of Asia.
sardonyx, a precious stone, white streaked with red.
Zarephath, a town in the district of Sidon in Phoenicia.
flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
a large measure equal to nearly three English gallons.
(a) I extinguish, quench, (b) I suppress, thwart.
I worship, stand in awe of.
an object of worship or veneration.

(official Greek equivalent of Augustus), venerated, august, a title of
                  the Roman emperors; hence secondarily: Augustan, imperial.
a shaking (as an earthquake); a storm.
I shake; fig: I agitate, stir up.
Seleucia, on the Syrian coast, the harbor of Syrian Antioch.
I am a lunatic, am moonstruck, epileptic.
Sergius, the middle (gentile) name of the proconsul of Cyprus.
I signify, indicate, give a sign, make known.
a sign, miracle, indication, mark, token.
I cause to rot, make corrupt.

intrans: I am silent, keep silence; trans: I keep secret; pass: I am
                  kept secret.
Sidon, a great coast city of Phoenicia.
an assassin, murderer, bandit; one of the Sicarii.

Silas, a pet-form of the name "Silvanus"; a Roman citizen and a helper
                  of Paul.
Silvanus, a Roman citizen and a helper of Paul.

Siloam, a spring within the walls, in the south-east corner of
                  Jerusalem.
mustard (probably the shrub, not the herb).
I sift, prove by trials, winnow.
a measured portion of grain or food
a measured portion of grain or food.
Zion, the hill; used for Jerusalem or heaven.
I keep silence, am silent, either voluntarily or involuntarily.

I cause to stumble, cause to sin, cause to become indignant, shock,
                  offend.
a snare, stumbling-block, cause for error.
a vessel to contain liquid, utensil, tackle

a vessel to contain liquid; a vessel of mercy or wrath; any instrument
                  by which anything is done; a household utensil; of ships: tackle.
a tent, booth, tabernacle, abode, dwelling, mansion, habitation.

the feast of tabernacles, the great festival of the Jews, held in
                  October.
a tent, tabernacle; fig: of the human body.
I dwell as in a tent, encamp
I dwell as in a tent, encamp, have my tabernacle.
a tent pitched, a dwelling, tabernacle.
a shadow, thick darkness, an outline
a shadow, shade, thick darkness, an outline.
hardness, hardness of heart, obstinacy, perverseness.
I harden, make hard, make stubborn.
a stake or thorn; fig: a sharp affliction.
I look at, regard attentively, take heed, beware, consider.
a watcher; a goal, a mark aimed at.

I disperse, scatter abroad (as of sheep); I dissipate, waste; I
                  distribute alms.
a Scythian, as typical of the uncivilized.
Smyrna, a great port of the Roman province Asia.
Solomon, son of David King of Israel, and Bathsheba.
Susannah, a woman of the retinue of Jesus.
wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence.
I make wise, instruct; pass: I am skillfully devised.
Spain, roughly co-extensive with the modern country of the name.
I swathe, wrap in swaddling clothes.
I live extravagantly, luxuriously; I am wanton.
a cohort, the tenth part of a legion; a military guard.
I pour out as a libation
I pour out as a libation.
(a) seed, commonly of cereals, (b) offspring, descendents.

a babbler, gossiper, one who picks up seeds and trifles as does a
                  bird.
I hasten, urge on, desire earnestly.
a hidden rock; fig: a flaw, stigma.
I feel compassion, have pity on, am moved.
the inward parts; the heart, affections, seat of the feelings.
I hasten, am eager, am zealous.
one eighth of a Roman mile

(a) a stadium, one eighth of a Roman mile, (b) a race-course for public
                  games.

an insurrection, dissension; originally: standing, position,
                  place.
an Attic silver coin equal in value to the Jewish shekel.
I fix to the cross, crucify; fig: I destroy, mortify.
Stachys, a Christian man at Rome.
a flat roof of a house
a flat roof of a house.
I cover, conceal, ward off, bear with, endure patiently.
I arrange, take care, withdraw from

I set, arrange; mid: I provide for, take care, withdraw from, hold
                  aloof, avoid.
I groan, expressing grief, anger, or desire.

(I keep some one in a tight place), I press upon, cramp,
                  restrain.
a narrow space, great distress, anguish.

Stephen, one of the seven original deacons at Jerusalem, and the first
                  martyr.
I stand fast, stand firm, persevere.

(a) I fix firmly, direct myself towards, (b) generally met: I buttress,
                  prop, support; I strengthen, establish.
a point of time, an instant
a moment, point of time, an instant.
I shine, glisten, flash, am radiant.
a bough, branch of a tree
a bough, branch of a tree.

(a) plur: the heavenly bodies, (b) a rudiment, an element, a
                  rudimentary principle, an elementary rule.
a long robe, worn by the upper classes in the East.
the mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
warfare, military service; of Christian warfare.

I wage war, fight, serve as a soldier; fig: of the warring lusts
                  against the soul.
a general, magistrate, captain of the temple

(a) a general or leader of the army, (b) a magistrate or governor, (c)
                  captain of the temple.

an army; met: a host of angels, the hosts of heaven (i.e. the
                  stars).
I collect an army, enlist troops.
commander of the Roman emperor's body-guard
commander of the Roman emperor's body-guard.
I twist, torture; met: I twist or pervert language.
I turn, am converted, change, change my direction.
I am gloomy, have a somber countenance, am shocked.
akin to, related; subst: fellow countryman, kinsman.
I cause to sit down with, sit down together
I cause to sit down with, sit down together.
I conceal closely, cover up wholly
I conceal closely, cover up wholly.
I give a vote with, assent to
I give a vote with, assent to.
I am voted or classed with
I am voted or classed with.
I move together, stir up, excite.
I enclose, shut in, make subject to.
I am a partaker with, have fellowship with, am an accomplice in.
I bear away together with, as in carrying away a corpse.
I join together, combine, compare, interpret, explain.
I am bowed together, bent double.
I bewilder, stir up, throw into confusion.
I yoke together, unite (as man and wife).
a disputer, as the Greek sophists.
a sycamore tree, black mulberry tree.
I plunder, lead captive; met: I make victim by fraud.
I seize, apprehend, assist, conceive, become pregnant.
I reason, reckon with myself, consider.
I am moved to grief by sympathy.
I ponder, encounter, confer or dispute with

properly: I throw together, hence: I ponder, come up with, encounter,
                  with or without hostile intent; I dispute with; mid: I confer, consult with,
                  contribute.

(a) I unite or knit together, (b) I put together in reasoning, and so:
                  I conclude, prove, (c) I teach, instruct.
I give advice, exhort; mid: I take counsel together, consult.

(a) a body of advisers (assessors) in a court, a council, (b) abstr:
                  consultation, counsel, advice; resolution, decree.
I partake with, divide together with, have a share in.
I bring to the same form with, conform
I bring to the same form with, conform.
I sympathize with, have compassion on
I sympathize with, have compassion on.
I come together with, stand by one, help.
I invite, encourage along with others

I invite, encourage along with others; pass: I share in encouragement
                  with.
I take along as a companion
I take along as a companion.
I remain or continue together with
I remain or continue together with.
I fill completely; pass: I am completed.
I choke utterly, as weeds do plants; I crowd upon.
I journey together with; I come together, assemble.
I bring together, collect; I am profitable to.
I assent to, consent, confess, agree with.
one of the same tribe, a fellow country-man.
I grow at the same time
I grow at the same time.
I agree with, harmonize with, agree together.
I compute, reckon up, count together.

I gather together, collect, assemble, receive with hospitality,
                  entertain.

an assembly, congregation, synagogue, either the place or the people
                  gathered together in the place.
I struggle in company with, aid.
I compete together with others, cooperate vigorously with.
I make a reckoning, settle accounts
I compare (settle) accounts, make a reckoning.
I mingle together with, keep company with.
I meet, encounter, fall in with.

I lend a hand along with, take interest in (a thing) along with
                  (others), assist jointly to perform some task, cooperate with, take my share in,
                  help, aid.
I lead away with, condescend to

I lead away with, carry along with (in good or bad sense according to
                  context); mid: I conform myself willingly to.
that which binds together; a band, bond.

I bind together; pass: I am bound together with, as of prisoners in
                  chains.

a fellow slave, fellow servant; of Christians: a fellow worker,
                  colleague.

a council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the
                  Sanhedrin.
I know, consider, am privy to
I know, consider, am privy to.
I am with, come together with.
I enter together with, embark with.
I unite in bearing witness, sanction.
I come or go with, accompany, assemble
I come or go with, accompany; I come together, assemble.

a putting together in the mind, hence: understanding, practical
                  discernment, intellect.
I consent, agree, am of one mind with
I consent, agree, am of one mind with, am willing.
I press together, confine, compel, am afflicted with

(a) I press together, close, (b) I press on every side, confine, (c) I
                  hold fast, (d) I urge, impel, (e) pass: I am afflicted with (sickness).
I break, break in pieces, crush, shatter.
I press on all sides, crowd upon.
I break in pieces, crush, thoroughly weaken
I break in pieces, crush, thoroughly weaken.
I commend, prove, am composed of, cohere

I place together, commend, prove, exhibit; instrans: I stand with; I am
                  composed of, cohere.
a company traveling together, a caravan
a company traveling together, a caravan.
I dwell with, live in wedlock with
I dwell with, live in wedlock with.
I am contiguous with, am next door to.
I arrange with, direct, appoint, prescribe, ordain.
I bring to an end, fulfill, accomplish.
I cut short, bring to swift accomplishment
I cut short, bring to swift accomplishment, determine, decide.
I preserve, keep safe, keep in mind
I preserve, keep safe, keep in mind, keep close.

mid. and pass: I make a compact (agreement) with (together), covenant
                  with, agree.
I break by crushing, break in pieces, shatter, crush, bruise.
one brought up with, a foster brother, an intimate friend.
I meet with, come to, fall in with.
Syntyche, a woman member of the church at Philippi.
I dissemble with, play a part with.
I help together, join in serving.
Syria, a great Roman imperial province, united with Cilicia.

Syrophoenician, i.e. Phoenician (of Syria, in contrast to Carthage and
                  its territory in North Africa).
Syrtis, a quicksand off the coast of North Africa.
I throw violently on the ground
I throw violently on the ground.

belonging to the same body; fig: of Jews and Gentiles belonging to the
                  same Church.
I contract, shorten, wrap around, swathe.
I am in the same rank with; I answer to, correspond to.
a fellow soldier (in the Christian faith).
a gathering together, riotous concourse, conspiracy.
I slay, kill by violence, slaughter, wound mortally.
I seal, set a seal upon.
a signet-ring, impression of a seal, the proof

a seal, signet ring, the impression of a seal, that which the seal
                  attests, the proof.
a rent, as in a garment; a division, dissention.
(a) I have leisure, (b) I stand empty (of a house).
leisure, a school, place where there is leisure.
body, flesh; the body of the Church.
bodily, corporeally, belonging to the body.
Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue at Corinth.

welfare, prosperity, deliverance, preservation, salvation,
                  safety.
I am of sound mind, am sober-minded, exercise self-control.
soundness of mind, sanity; self-control, sobriety.

of sound mind, self-controlled, temperate, sober-minded, modest,
                  chaste.
